summary: Muhammad, the founder of Islam, had 11 wives. He first married Khadija when he was 25, and they were together for 24 years until her death. After that, he married 10 more women, mostly widows or divorcees. He had seven children, mostly with Khadija. These marriages happened after he moved from Mecca to Medina to escape persecution. Muslims respectfully call his wives "Mother of the Believers."
title: Wives of Muhammad
